Experience: 5.00 + years

Salary: AUD 63321-79151 / year (based on experience)

Expected Notice Period: 15 Days

Shift: (GMT+05:30) Asia/Kolkata (IST)

Opportunity Type: Remote

Placement Type: Full Time Permanent position(Payroll and Compliance to be managed by: TBC)

(*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' client - Transvirtual)

What do you need for this opportunity?

Must have skills required:

CSS, WinForms, Asp.net, Android, C#, HTML, iOS, JavaScript, JQuery, MVC

Transvirtual is Looking for:

Description

Key responsibilities:

We’re on the lookout for a software engineer to join our growing team.

Our products support the logistics industry in our aim to automate and eliminate manual work processes. You’ll support the growth these products working in collaboration with product, support and other engineers.

You’ll be required to understand complex problems and work with the team to turn these into simple solutions.

You’ll be a part of sprint planning, backlog grooming and share you progress in daily stand ups.

What we’re looking for:

Tech: Passionate about tech, confident with data, databases, and coding languages.
Cybersecurity: Grasp of security principles to keep data safe.
Domain Knowledge: You have product exposure to popular ecommerce and logistics platforms. You are motivated to learn and analyse many more platforms.


Why you will love this role:

The opportunity to make a difference: we are not a large company tied down by bureaucracy, you can implement work quickly and see results
Own your role and the integrations execution: You’ll partner with engineering, product and support to understand the landscape and where efforts are needed. You’ll take that direction to scope and provide excellent detail for engineering to quickly deliver
Lots of opportunity to learn and grow: You will be working with Transvirtual subject matter experts to ensure you can make an immediate impact. They are also very open to ideas and new initiatives that you come up with. 
Time to execute, not time in meetings: we do have a couple of set meetings and lots of collaboration within the team, but the majority of your time will be used to execute your work.
Friendly, hybrid international team: we are a fun team, headquartered in Australia, but also spread across the globe. You will get the chance to collaborate with multiple teams who are all inclusive and open.


Essential Skills / qualifications:

5-7 years' experience of C#, ASP.NET, MVC, JavaScript and jQuery
Highly organized
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
University or equivalent qualification in Computer science, IT or business
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Adaptable and manage change fluidly 
Can reliably produce results


Desired Skills

Have exposure to different working methodologies in multiple teams to understand how to flex process to maintain focus on goals
Worked in a Logistics (TMS/WMS), SaaS or Technology focused business
More of a bonus than desired - HTML, CSS, C# WinForms, Android, iOS, React Native/Flutter, Vue.js experience


About Transvirtual:

We’re a modern SaaS business delivering logistics solutions. Our founder’s family history is steeped in transport giving Transvirtual a unique competitive advantage which has seen the business grow from strength to strength. The business received its first outside investment three years ago and has grown significantly, including growing our product set from its core of a Transport Management System (TMS) to launching in the US and expanding to offering a Warehouse Management System (WMS).

Being a distributed business we work really hard to connect the team ensuring visibility of business strategy, sharing OKRs and hosting company wide retros. We challenge each other to be the best and ensure we seek & provide regular feedback to maintain a positive and enjoyable workplace.

Our team is comprised of Technology, Logistics and Growth experts and if you’re excited by the opportunity, we’d love to hear from you.

Tech: Passionate about tech, confident with data, databases, and coding languages.
Cybersecurity: Grasp of security principles to keep data safe.
Domain Knowledge: You have product exposure to popular ecommerce and logistics platforms. You are motivated to learn and analyse many more platforms.


Why you will love this role:

The opportunity to make a difference: we are not a large company tied down by bureaucracy, you can implement work quickly and see results
Own your role and the integrations execution: You’ll partner with engineering, product and support to understand the landscape and where efforts are needed. You’ll take that direction to scope and provide excellent detail for engineering to quickly deliver
Lots of opportunity to learn and grow: You will be working with Transvirtual subject matter experts to ensure you can make an immediate impact. They are also very open to ideas and new initiatives that you come up with. 
Time to execute, not time in meetings: we do have a couple of set meetings and lots of collaboration within the team, but the majority of your time will be used to execute your work.
Friendly, hybrid international team: we are a fun team, headquartered in Australia, but also spread across the globe. You will get the chance to collaborate with multiple teams who are all inclusive and open.


Essential Skills / qualifications:

5-7 years' experience of C#, ASP.NET, MVC, JavaScript and jQuery
Highly organized
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
University or equivalent qualification in Computer science, IT or business
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Adaptable and manage change fluidly 
Can reliably produce results


Desired Skills

Have exposure to different working methodologies in multiple teams to understand how to flex process to maintain focus on goals
Worked in a Logistics (TMS/WMS), SaaS or Technology focused business
More of a bonus than desired - HTML, CSS, C# WinForms, Android, iOS, React Native/Flutter, Vue.js experience


About Transvirtual:

We’re a modern SaaS business delivering logistics solutions. Our founder’s family history is steeped in transport giving Transvirtual a unique competitive advantage which has seen the business grow from strength to strength. The business received its first outside investment three years ago and has grown significantly, including growing our product set from its core of a Transport Management System (TMS) to launching in the US and expanding to offering a Warehouse Management System (WMS).

Being a distributed business we work really hard to connect the team ensuring visibility of business strategy, sharing OKRs and hosting company wide retros. We challenge each other to be the best and ensure we seek & provide regular feedback to maintain a positive and enjoyable workplace.

Our team is comprised of Technology, Logistics and Growth experts and if you’re excited by the opportunity, we’d love to hear from you.

How to apply for this opportunity?

Step 1: Click On Apply! And Register or Login on our portal.
Step 2: Complete the Screening Form & Upload updated Resume
Step 3: Increase your chances to get shortlisted & meet the client for the Interview!
